data.text:
Thank you  every one in Hilton especially reception 
Mr.Mohamed Barakat for your helpful and support 
( he was a very gentleman)
I and my family we enjoyed so much 

Hotel recommended to everyone and we will back soon 

Best regards 
Novert Awdalla
Pedro Fouad
data.title: Lovely stay

data.text:
Best trip ever 
It should a very exhausting trip because we went with our 3 kids BUT THE STAFF was perfect and so helpful... we didnt need even a small thing. Mr mohamed was very welcoming and Captain ateff was very helpful in the restaurant.5strs
data.title: A very helpful staff in a very beautiful and calm space

data.text: We arrived in the evening it was my first time taking my teenage daughters away as a single parent but my eldest daughter was sick and couldn’t come so she stayed home with her mum I was hoping the hotel would understand and help me out with the cost but they wasn’t interested at all and charged me the full price for her even though she would be there or eating from the all inclusive buffet! I brought this up twice with two different staff members but they was not interested in helping not even suggesting they would help contact Expedia to explain for me! Hotel was ok but not very busy at all, entertainment staff were friendly but wasn’t many people for them to entertain! But my dad was hounded for 3 days for money from the doctor after he was put on a drip for a cough he had, he only went to ask for cough syrup! They wanted £150 excess or were threatening to charge the full £600!
data.title: Not helpful

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for posting your comments on our hotel.

We apologize for any dissatisfaction you went through as you find the hotel not up to your expectation. 

regarding the doctor payment kindly note that the clinic is 3rd party however the doctor was offing to cover the medica by insurance, but you refused.

also, regarding the Expedia reservations as confirmed not changeable by the hotel only by Expedia.

Please accept our sincere apology and note that your comments are discussed with the concerned managers to take the necessary actions.

We value your opinion as a good tool for improvement.

We look forward to welcoming you back and giving us another chance to prove to you the Hilton hospitality. 

Regards,

Hotel Management
owner_response.author: Hassan  Hassanein

data.text:
I've stayed at this hotel twice thus far, the first time being in October 2023, and then recently in February 2024.

I am very happy with this hotel. The service is of an excellent standard, I did not have any reason to complain. The staff are very helpful and engaging. 

ACCOMMODATION/ROOM

During my visit in October 2023, I stayed at the beachfront building. There are two, the mountainside and the beachfront. This building was closer to the beach - a 1-minute walk - and had a restaurant for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. A pool bar, spa, gym, private doctor's clinic and pools.

My room was spacious, and the AC was essential! It was so hot that you could put your clothes out to dry and it'll be done within an hour! I had a balcony view on the second floor, so I could put the clothes out there safely to dry.

The TV was fully working, and there was a limited range of channels, but was hardly in the room! The mini fridge fully working, so I could put any drinks I brought from the local shops there, as well as chilled snacks. 

Bathroom - fully working, nice spacious shower. 
Bed - double and very comfortable.
Space - a good amount of space, with table chairs, and the wardrobes had ample space! 
SAFE - didn't work, but was soon fixed by on-site maintenance and I could store my stuff in there without any worry!

During my staff in February 2024, the beachside building was closed for renovation, so I stayed in the mountainside.

This was the main building, reception is based here, as well as swimming pools, restaurant, a la carte restaurant, bar and entertainment. 

My room was upgraded courtesy of the hotel, and I had a bigger walk-in shower, bath, balcony and slightly larger room. However, the room was on the ground floor, so didn't leave clothes out for long or when I wasn't in the room!

VERY happy with the room, no complaints at all!

FOOD - ALL INCLUSIVE

It's OK. I'm not going to say it's the best I've had, but I had no reason to complain. You have a good variety for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Soft drinks are included at the bar.

The food was cooked, hotel and I particularly liked the roast chicken, mash, fries and variety of different breads and salads. 

You won't get served drinks at the table, you have to go up to the drinks area and request a soft drink. Fruit juices are available via their machines, just take a glass and help yourself, but for hot drinks, soft drinks you have to ask the staff behind that area.

If you're not careful, other guests could take your table if you're away from it for a period of time. As a solo traveller, it did happen twice, but I found other tables free, so if you're going as a couple/family, then have someone stay at the table so it's not taken!

THINGS TO DO!

My favourite bit!

I love to dive/snorkel, and this hotel has so far the best house reef I've seen! The beach area is small, but you do have other parts as you walk to the entrance where you can grab a beach chair and towel and relax. You'll be given a card to hand to the staff to grab a towel, simply return your towel and they'll give your the reusable card back.

The beach starts off shallow, but the jetty goes over the coral and then at the end it's about 7.8m deep, so be weary of this. If you're not a confident swimmer, then maybe ask for a life jacket or stay close to the jetty.

If you swim out within the beach area of the hotel, you'll see two high reefs with ambundance of sea life! It's a fantastic snorkel experience and most of the fish will come up to you as they're always curious! 

There is an on-site dive centre called Sinai Dive Centre. I used them for two intro dives, which was about £40-50 and lasts 25 minutes. Mustafa who is the Dive Master was amazing! He's professional, friendly and we dived at the house reef and I got to see all the other fish at the bottom, including sting rays, a lion fish (don't touch!), sand fish (another one to not touch!) and much, much more!

If you're going to dive, then be aware that you'll need to complete a medical form, and be deemed fit to dive by the centre based on your answers on the form. If you need a fit to dive from a doctor, you should do this in the UK as in Egypt this wouldn't be covered by travel insurance! 

Back on land... the hotel is within the vicinity of 'Soho Square' - a truly lavish array of shops, visual attractions and a great place to wonder!

All within walking distance from the hotel, you have pharmacies, supermarkets, perfume shops, souvenir shops and another dive centre.

In Soho Square, you will be amazed by all the places on offer: cafes, restaurants, mobile phone shops, carpet(!) shops, another supermarket, hotels, even an estate agent! 

Now the somewhat 'negative' - things are seriously a rip-off! Especially in Soho Square, be prepared to haggle, but there will be a limit up to which the traders will no longer haggle, after which it's a 'take it or leave it'. They're not allowed to hassle the tourists, and there's security check points around the square, hotels and entrance/exits, so you're safe!

There is an amazing water fountain display, which reacts to music with lights! Kids will love it as well as the grown-ups. Next to it are ice cream stalls for Gelato, and a waffle place!

Finally, in October 2023 I did venture out to the McDonalds, which is a taxi ride away, approx £12-14. I didn't venture out on my recent trip, to be honest, I was entertained within the square. 

If you want to plan excursions, the hotel can help you with this, or your tour guide. Remember, keep it official, so try to avoid anyone 'off the street', and if you want security, then book the taxi from the hotel (they have a private taxi firm there), but if you want it cheaper, then catch a taxi on the street outside of the square! The taxis in the car park outside of the hotel are all private. The public taxis are coloured differently, the hotel will advise you.

WEATHER

October 2023 - high 30s!!
February 2024 - high 20s!!

Message - always hot and wonderful! Excellent weather!!

SAFETY

Sharm-el-Sheikh at the time of writing this is a safe city. It's surprisingly small! Compared to Luxor, Cairo etc, it's the main tourist area, and Egypt takes tourism very seriously. It's the main income of the economy, so you will have police and security presence not only around your hotel, but outside in the city.

It's safe to walk around, even in the markets, obviously, always be alert, it is a foreign country! But there is issues or problems from any of the neighbouring conflicts, you're quite a distance away from it.
data.title: Amazing snorkelling and diving experience - excellent location - good food - nice vibe - helpful staff

owner_response.title: Owner response
owner_response.text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for posting your comments on our hotel.

Our team appreciates your feedback very much, which is a great tool for more progress and success. 

May I thank you once again for your feedback and we look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.

Yours sincerely, 

Hassan Hassanein 
General Manager
owner_response.author: Hassan  Hassanein

data.text:
We stayed at doubletree by Hilton sharks bay and check-in was very quick and went to the room with buggy 
Room was very large and clean with very nice view 
The Staff was amazing and respectful and we would Luke to thank Mar.Mohamed barakat from reception for his efforts to create holiday atmospher 
The Beach is clean and large and we enjoyed snorkling 
Food was tasty and alot of veriaty
Thanks for hosbitality and we will come back😍
data.title: Pleasant hotel
